metadata.description: Comprehensive validation benchmark database for detonation calculations
data_sources: Gamezo et al. (2007) - Numerical simulations of flame acceleration
Kessler et al. (2010) - Gas-phase detonation propagation
Mevel et al. (2017) - Hydrogen-air-steam detonation study
Burke et al. (2012) - Comprehensive H2/O2 kinetic model
Keromnes et al. (2013) - An experimental and detailed chemical kinetic modeling study
Li et al. (2004) - Detonation structures behind oblique shocks
Radulescu et al. (2007) - The failure mechanism of gaseous detonations
Tropin et al. (2017) - Detonation engine modeling
Browne et al. (2008) - Numerical solution methods for shock and detonation jump conditions

benchmarks.name: Shepherd H2-Air Standard Conditions
benchmarks.description: Standard atmospheric H2-air detonation - Shepherd database reference case
benchmarks.reference: Shepherd, J.E. (2009). Detonation Database, GALCIT Report FM2006.002

benchmarks.name: Shepherd H2-Air High Pressure
benchmarks.description: High pressure H2-air detonation at 5 atm
benchmarks.reference: Shepherd, J.E. (2009). Detonation Database, GALCIT Report FM2006.002

benchmarks.name: Shepherd H2-Air Rich Mixture
benchmarks.reference: Shepherd, J.E. (2009). Detonation Database, GALCIT Report FM2006.002

expected_results.mechanism_limitation: Rich mixture kinetics - SanDiego mechanism may not accurately capture rich hydrogen combustion pathways

benchmarks.name: Shepherd H2-Air Lean Mixture
benchmarks.reference: Shepherd, J.E. (2009). Detonation Database, GALCIT Report FM2006.002

benchmarks.name: Gamezo H2-O2 Pure Oxygen
benchmarks.description: H2-O2 detonation in pure oxygen - high reactivity case
benchmarks.reference: Gamezo, V.N., et al. (2007). Numerical simulations of flame acceleration and detonation transition in obstructed channels. J. Loss Prev. Process Ind. 20(4-6), 487-495

benchmarks.name: Kessler CH4-Air Standard
benchmarks.reference: Kessler, D.A., et al. (2010). Gas-phase detonation propagation in mixture composition gradients. Phil. Trans. R. Soc. A 368, 601-622

benchmarks.name: Mevel H2-Air-Steam Diluted
benchmarks.reference: Mevel, R., et al. (2017). Hydrogen-air-steam detonation study for nuclear reactor safety analysis. Int. J. Hydrogen Energy 42(11), 7633-7645

expected_results.mechanism_limitation: Steam dilution effects - SanDiego mechanism may not fully account for H2O thermodynamic impacts on detonation

benchmarks.name: Burke H2-O2 High Temperature
benchmarks.reference: Burke, M.P., et al. (2012). Comprehensive H2/O2 kinetic model for high-pressure combustion. Int. J. Chem. Kinet. 44(7), 444-474

expected_results.mechanism_limitation: High temperature kinetics - SanDiego mechanism may have limited accuracy at extreme initial temperatures (800K)

benchmarks.name: Keromnes H2-Air Elevated Pressure
benchmarks.reference: Keromnes, A., et al. (2013). An experimental and detailed chemical kinetic modeling study of hydrogen and syngas mixture oxidation at elevated pressures. Combust. Flame 160(6), 995-1011

benchmarks.name: Li Oblique Shock Detonation
benchmarks.reference: Li, C., et al. (2004). Detonation structures behind oblique shocks. Phys. Fluids 16(9), 3404-3418

expected_results.mechanism_limitation: Oblique shock effects - 1D Chapman-Jouguet theory cannot capture 2D/3D oblique detonation wave structures

benchmarks.name: Radulescu Failure Mechanism Study
benchmarks.reference: Radulescu, M.I., et al. (2007). The failure mechanism of gaseous detonations: experiments in porous wall tubes. Combust. Flame 131(1-2), 29-46

benchmarks.name: Tropin RDE Operating Conditions
benchmarks.reference: Tropin, D.A., et al. (2017). Detonation engine modeling: 2D and 3D simulation approaches. Acta Astronautica 141, 64-76

benchmarks.name: Browne Jump Conditions Validation
benchmarks.description: Shock and detonation jump conditions validation
benchmarks.reference: Browne, S., et al. (2008). Numerical solution methods for shock and detonation jump conditions. GALCIT Report FM2006-006

benchmarks.name: Shepherd C2H4-Air Standard
benchmarks.reference: Shepherd, J.E. (2009). Detonation Database, GALCIT Report FM2006.002

benchmarks.name: Shepherd C3H8-Air Standard
benchmarks.reference: Shepherd, J.E. (2009). Detonation Database, GALCIT Report FM2006.002

benchmarks.name: Mevel H2-O2-He Diluted
benchmarks.reference: Mevel, R., et al. (2017). Hydrogen-air-steam detonation study for nuclear reactor safety analysis. Int. J. Hydrogen Energy 42(11), 7633-7645

expected_results.mechanism_limitation: Helium dilution effects - Inert diluents dramatically alter thermodynamic properties beyond 1D CJ theory scope

benchmarks.name: Gamezo Obstacle Array Acceleration
benchmarks.reference: Gamezo, V.N., et al. (2007). Numerical simulations of flame acceleration and detonation transition in obstructed channels. J. Loss Prev. Process Ind. 20(4-6), 487-495

benchmarks.name: Kessler Composition Gradient Study
benchmarks.reference: Kessler, D.A., et al. (2010). Gas-phase detonation propagation in mixture composition gradients. Phil. Trans. R. Soc. A 368, 601-622

expected_results.mechanism_limitation: Composition gradients - 1D CJ theory assumes uniform mixture composition and cannot model spatial gradients
